content:
• Tuesday, December 4, 2018

  • Modest advance for futures

    • S&P 500 futures are up 0.4% following this afternoon's 3%+ drubbing. Nasdaq futures are up 0.5% and DJIA futures 0.3%.
    • Asian markets are open and not faring too badly, with the Hang Seng down 1.5%, Shanghai off 0.4%, and the Nikkei lower by 0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 PM | 8 Comments
  • SNNVF

    After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: OTCQB:SNNVF +6.5%. OTCPK:TXHPF +3.9%.
    • Losers: RFIL -8.2%. GWRE -5.2%. OLLI -5.0%. TTD -2.2%. FCAU -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 12 Comments
  • INSG

    Inseego +3.5% on plans for 5G telemedicine live demo

    • Inseego (NASDAQ:INSG) is up 3.5% in postmarket action after it and Verizon (NYSE:VZ) announce a live virtual reality telemedicine demonstration using their next-gen technology.
    • The two will unveil MiFi 5G NR mobile broadband in Maui, at the Qualcomm Snapdragon Technology Summit.
    • The demo will involve using an Inseego mobile hotspot (which uses the Snapdragon 855 Mobile Platform and Snapdragon X50 5G modem/antenna modules) on Verizon's 5G NR network.
    • Inseego's 5G hotspot will be a Verizon exclusive when it hits general availability in 2019.
    • Previously: Inseego -3.1% as revenue disappoints on supply chain problems (Nov. 06 2018)
    • Previously: Inseego launches gigabit mobile hotspot on Verizon (Oct. 30 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM | 7 Comments
  • TTD

    Trade Desk COO plans exit; shares down 2.2%

    • Rob Perdue plans to exit the role of chief operating officer of The Trade Desk (NASDAQ:TTD).
    • He's been COO since joining the company in 2013 and led it through its 2016 IPO.
    • He'll leave after a transition period in the first half of 2019. The company has begun a search for a new COO.
    • Shares are down 2.2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 14 Comments
  • GWRE

    Guidewire -4% on Q1 beats, downside guidance

    • Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE) drops 4.3% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat estimates with a 66% Y/Y revenue growth. Downside Q2 guidance has revenue of $157M to $161M (consensus: $170.0M) and EPS of $0.17 to $0.21 (consensus: $0.25).
    • FY guidance has downside revenue of $722M to $732M (consensus: $751.1M) and upside EPS of $1.24 to $1.34 (consensus: $1.22).
    • Revenue breakdown: License, $94.3M (consensus: $76M); Maintenance, $21M (consensus: $19.5M); Services, $64.4M (consensus: $66.8M).
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Guidewire Software beats by $0.16, beats on revenue (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDB

    MongoDB reports Q3 beats, upside FY guidance

    • MongoDB (NASDAQ:MDB) gains 1% aftermarket on Q3 beats with revenue of $65M (Capital IQ consensus: $60.26M) and EPS of -$0.30 (consensus: -$0.40).
    • Q4 guidance has upside revenue of $73M to $74M (consensus: $64.77M) and in-line EPS of -$0.39 to -$0.38 (consensus: -$0.39).
    • Upside FY19 guidance has revenue of $243.7M to $244.7M (consensus: $230.6M) and EPS of -$1.53 to -$1.52 (consensus: -$1.63).
    • Revenue breakdown: Subscription, $60.1M (consensus: $55.8M; +59% Y/Y); Services, $4.9M (consensus: $4.5M).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: MongoDB reports Q3 results (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • HPE

    HP Enterprise +2% as Q4 EPS tops high end of guidance

    • Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE:HPE) is up 2% after hours following its beat on top and bottom lines in fiscal Q4 earnings, with gains in its core hybrid IT segment and in Intelligent Edge more than making up for a drop in Financial Services.
    • Revenues grew 4% Y/Y (up 3% adjusting for currency), and EPS of $0.45 (up 55% Y/Y) topped not only Street consensus but the high end of company guidance.
    • Cash flow from operations was $1.3B, up $0.4B Y/Y.
    • Revenue by segment: Hybrid IT, $6.4B (up 5%); Financial Services, $939M (down 7%); Intelligent Edge, $814M (up 17%).
    • In Hybrid IT, operating margin was 1.9%; Compute revenue rose 9%, Storage revenue rose 6%, DC Networking revenue gained 2%, and HPE Pointnext revenue fell 3%.
    • In Financial Services, net portfolio assets were flat while financing volume rose 8%. Operating margin was 7.8%.
    • In Intelligent Edge, operating margin was 10.1%. HPE Aruba Product revenue grew 17%; HPE Aruba Services revenue rose 16%.
    • For Q1, it's estimating EPS of $0.33-$0.37 (non-GAAP, excludes after-tax costs of about $0.14/share). For the full year, it sees EPS at $1.51-$1.61.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: Hewlett Packard Enterprise beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Dec. 04 2018)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRVL

    Marvell +4% on Q3 beats, mixed guide

    • Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) gains 4.1% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with 38% Y/Y revenue growth. The report marks the first full quarter of Marvell and Cavium acting as a combined team, and the company says it has achieved key integration milestones ahead of schedule.
    • Q4 guidance has downside revenue of $790M to $830M (consensus: $849M) and in-line EPS of $0.30 to $0.34 (consensus: $0.33).
    • Revenue breakdown: Storage, $406.8M (consensus: $404.7M); Networking, $398.4M (consensus $394.0M); Other, $45.8M (consensus: $50.5M).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:45 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Marvell Technology Group beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • OLLI

    Ollie's slides after guidance disappoints

    • Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings (NASDAQ:OLLI) reports comparable sales increased 4.6% in Q3 to mark the retailer's operator's 18th consecutive positive comp.
    • Total sales were up 19% as a 12% higher store count factored in during the quarter.
    • EBITDA came in at $34.7M vs. $29.2M a year ago and $35.M consensus.
    • Looking ahead, Ollie's expects full-year sales of between $1.226B to $1.231B vs. $1.23B consensus and adjusted net income of $115M to $117M. EPS of $1.74 to $1.77 is anticipated vs. $1.76 consensus.
    • Shares of Ollie's are down 6.9% in AH trading.
    • Previously: Ollie's Bargain Outlet beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 19 Comments
  • MRVL

    Marvell Technology Group beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Marvell Technology Group (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.01; GAAP EPS of -$0.08 misses by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $851.05M (+38.1% Y/Y) beats by $7.04M.
    • Shares +1.4%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • RDHL

    RedHill launches equity offering

    • RedHill Biopharma (NASDAQ:RDHL) initiates a public offering of American Depositary Shares (ADSs), each representing 10 ordinary shares. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 23 Comments

  • Gold quiet amid panicky selloff in stocks

    • Three-plus percent declines in the S&P 500 and DJIA, and a near-4% slide in the Nasdaq are failing to create a bid for gold.
    • The yellow metal is up a scant 0.35% to $1,244 per ounce 15 minutes ahead of the close of the stock market.
    • The big story in metals may be the big move in palladium, up another 1.45% today, and now just $60 per ounce from taking over as the most valuable precious metal.
    • ETFs: GLD, IAU, CEF, PHYS, PALL, SGOL, UGLD, UGL, SPPP, DGP, GLL, GTU, GLDI, OUNZ, DZZ, DGL, DGLD, GLTR, DGZ, DBP, GYEN, BAR, GEUR, GLDW
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 18 Comments
  • SLB

    Schlumberger -4% as Q4 North American revenues could slide 15%

    • Schlumberger (SLB -4.6%) tumbles after warning its Q4 North America revenues could fall 15% Q/Q because of steeper than expected price declines in hydraulic fracturing.
    • This year's decline in fracking activity has been "significantly larger" than expected, executive VP Patrick Schorn said today at a conference in New York, leading to a bigger decline in pricing than the company had forecast.
    • Recent price declines likely will cause customers to take "a more conservative" approach early in 2019 and any ramp-up in international investment also could be tepid, Schorn said.
    • SLB's North America revenue, including its Cameron International business, was $3.12B during Q3, accounting for ~38% of total revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 46 Comments
  • DVN

    Oil flat, but energy shares lower as averages tumble

    • The major selloff in stocks (S&P 500 down 3%) isn't hitting crude oil, which is unchanged at $52.96 per barrel. The Energy SPDR (NYSEARCA:XLE) is outperforming the S&P by a hair, down 2.4%.
    • In company-specific news, Devon Energy (DVN -1.6%) is expecting capex spend next year of $2.4B-$2.7B vs. Bloomberg consensus of $2.76B. 2018 capex is still seen at $2.4B.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWT, UCO, DWT, SCO, BNO, DBO, UGA, DTO, USL, DNO, OLO, DBE, UHN, SZO, OLEM, RJN
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 11 Comments
  • MYL

    Mylan expands valsartan recall

    • Citing a need to be cautious, Mylan N.V. (MYL -3.4%) has expanded its voluntary recall of valsartan-containing products to an additional 104 lots due to the presence of an impurity called NDEA.
    • Previously: Mylan recalls 15 lots of blood-pressure drug containing valsartan (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon, Stamps.com drop on suggested USPS hike

    • A commission appointed by President Trump recommends that the U.S. Postal Service hike its rates for shipping packages.
    • Trump assembled the commission after slamming Amazon (AMZN -5.9%) for allegedly underpaying the USPS for package shipments.
    • Commission member and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin: "Today’s report contains achievable recommendations that fulfill the President’s goal of placing the USPS on a path to sustainability, while protecting taxpayers from undue financial burdens and providing them with necessary mail services.”
    • Last month, the USPS reported FY18 results with an overall volume decline of 3.2B pieces and a net loss of $3.9B. Revenue was up $1B Y/Y largely due to the Shipping and Packages business, which had a 10% Y/Y revenue growth to $2.1B.
    • Amazon shares are down 5% on the news while Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP) is down 5%, UPS (NYSE:UPS) drops 7%, and FedEx (NYSE:FDX) dips 5.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 97 Comments
  • ANY

    Technology movers and shakers

    • Gainers: Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +15%. Net Element (NASDAQ:NETE) +12%. Professional Diversity Network (NASDAQ:IPDN) +6%. Leaf Group (NYSE:LEAF) +6%. AGM Group Holdings (NASDAQ:AGMH) +6%.
    • Losers: ReneSola (NYSE:SOL) -16%. Innodata (NASDAQ:INOD) -15%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) -12%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) -12%. The9 (NASDAQ:NCTY) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • TEL

    Jefferies launches TE Connectivity at Hold

    • TE Connectivity (TEL -3.8%) has gotten a start at Jefferies with a Hold rating, a stance that puts it in the minority against more than a dozen Buy-equivalent ratings.
    • The firm set its price target to $84, implying 7.9% upside from yesterday's close and now 12.2% upside from today's lower price.
    • Shares have declined 18.4% over the past six months but are up 3.2% over the past week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • VEEV

    Veeva sinks 4.5% on bearish Citron tweet

    • Veeva Systems (NYSE:VEEV) has taken a turn for the worse, down 4.5% now but off lows from a sudden plunge, after Citron Research tweets out a price target indicating 34% downside from yesterday's price.
    • The firm's price target is $65, vs. yesterday's close of $98.90.
    • "Competition has arrived as multiple is at peak and short interest at low," Citron says. "Same setup as NVDA at $280. A market correction will hit $VEEV harder than any other SaaS name. Buyout off the table until $40."
    • Previously: Leerink starts Veeva at 21% upside (Dec. 04 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 36 Comments
  • PG

    Investors play defense with Coca-Cola, McDonald's and P&G

    • Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG), Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) and McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) are all up about 0.3%, despite the large market decline today (Dow -2.4%, S&P 500 -2.3%, Nasdaq -2.6%, Russell 2000 -3.3%).
    • Analysts have noted that the three Dow components have been use by investors over the last few weeks as a defensive strategy at an even higher correlation than in the past.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 16 Comments

  • Utilities bid higher as markets tank

    • Today's big, broad selloff is sparing no sector except for the utilities (XLU +0.6%), seeing a nice flow of investor cash as the S&P falls 2.5% and the 10-year Treasury yield drops 5.6 basis points to just 2.91%.
    • It was only a bit more than two months ago when the S&P 500 was outperforming the XLU by a wide margin for 2018. Flash forward to today, and the S&P 500's 1.1% YTD advance is a full 700 basis points worse than the utility SPDR.
    • ETFs: XLU, UTG, VPU, GUT, IDU, BUI, FUTY, RYU, UPW, FXU, SDP, FUGAX, JHMU
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 10 Comments
  • PSA

    Self-storage REITs a bright spot in big selloff

    • The REIT sector often sees some buying on days like this when the major averages sell off and interest rates fall. The iShares U.S. Real Estate ETF (IYR -0.9%), however, is in the red (though outperforming the S&P 500's 2.6% decline by a wide margin).
    • What's working in REITs? Interestingly, the only group within that sector in the green are the self-storage players - Public Storage (PSA +0.7%), Extra Space Storage (EXR +0.1%), CubeSmart (CUBE +0.4%), and Life Storage (LSI +0.3%) among them. After all, if the economy is headed south and homebuying is in the dumps (see Toll Brothers results today), self-storage cubicles should benefit?
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 7 Comments
  • PCAR

    PACCAR boosts buyback firepower

    • PACCAR (PCAR -2.2%) announces that its board approved a $500M share repurchase program.
    • The company says stock repurchases of $124.8M are remaining under the current $300M stock repurchase program.
    • "PACCAR’s consistent growth in global vehicle market share over the last 20 years has generated increased profits in its aftermarket parts and finance segments. This profitable aftermarket business has become a larger portion of PACCAR’s overall earnings and contributes towards steady financial results," says PACCAR Chairman Mark Pigott.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • HMY

    Harmony Gold Mining and Mexco Energy among Energy/Materials gainers; Amyris, and FTS International among losers

    • Gainers: Harmony Gold Mining (NYSE:HMY) +7%. Mexco Energy (NYSEMKT:MXC) +7%. Gold Fields (NYSE:GFI) +6%.
    • Losers: Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS) -13%. FTS International (NYSE:FTSI) -10%. Pioneer Energy Services (NYSE:PES) -10%. Keane Group (NYSE:FRAC) -9%. Marrone Bio Innovations (NASDAQ:MBII) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • Z

    Zillow adds nine new listing partners in Canada

    • Zillow Group (Z -3.3%, ZG -3.3%) has listing deals with nine new partners in Canada
    • The company has more than doubled its agreements with brokers and franchisors up north.
    • "Our Canadian partnerships are already driving increased traffic to Zillow, with more than half a million Canadian home shoppers visiting each month," says Zillow's Errol Samuelson.
    • The new partners include HomeLife Real Estate Canada, Sage Real Estate, Your Choice Realty, Coldwell Banker Mountain Central, Coldwell Banker Ronan Realty, Royal Heritage Realty, Sam McDadi Real Estate, Sutton Group Heritage Realty Inc., and TrilliumWest Real Estate.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • VIA

    Viacom boosts tender offers after high early demand

    • After measuring early results for its tender offers, Viacom (VIA -1.4%, VIAB -1.8%) has increased the amounts on both a capped tender offer and waterfall tender, and changed the expiration date on the offers.
    • The offers will now expire on Dec. 18.
    • Viacom is increasing the capped tender amount from $300M to $329.85M, and increasing the waterfall tender from $700M to an amount equal to the difference of $1.1B minus the aggregate purchase price of the capped tender notes accepted for purchase.
    • The company says $329.85M in notes were validly tendered on the capped offer, and $3.17B in waterfall notes were tendered by the early deadline.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • TWST

    Twist Bio adds to strong IPO, up 19%

    • Thinly traded Twist Bioscience (TWST +18.6%) is up on modestly higher volume. Shares have more than doubled since it debuted at $14 on October 31.
    • The company has developed a DNA synthesis platform that it says enables the production of synthetic DNA on a silicon chip.
    • Previously: Twist Bioscience on deck for IPO (Oct. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • URI

    Equipment rental stocks bid down

    • Equipment rental stocks United Rentals (URI -10.6%), Herc Holdings (HRI -11.1%) and H&E Equipment Services (HEES -10.4%) are down sharply amid a broad downturn in the transportation sector.
    • Investors also have their eyes on the drop in orders reported by Toll Brothers today.
    • Previously: Toll Brothers -5.6% after Q4 shows demand slipping (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 18 Comments
  • SCG

    SCANA's $2.1B settlement with customers wins preliminary approval by judge

    • A South Carolina judge gives preliminary approval to SCANA’s (SCG +2%) $2.1B settlement with its 730K electric customers in the state over high power bills stemming from the failed V.C. Summer nuclear construction project, The State reports.
    • The decision brings electric customers of SCANA’s SCG&E subsidiary a step closer to cash payouts and rate credits after they collectively paid more than $2B in higher electric rates for the abandoned project.
    • The settlement depends on the South Carolina Public Service Commission approving Dominion Energy’s (D +1.4%) offer to buy SCANA and lower the typical SCE&G customer’s power bill by as much as $22/month; a decision is expected by Dec. 21.
      Read more here: https://www.thestate.com/news/politics-government/article222566915.html#storylink=cpy
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 12 Comments
  • SPWR

    First Solar earns second upgrade in two days; shares -3% anyway

    • Solar stocks surrender yesterday's gains that followed news of the U.S.-China trade truce: SPWR -3.3%, JKS -3.6%, CSIQ -2.9%, SEDG -3.2%, VSLR -2.3%, RUN -3.3%, DQ -4.2%, OTCPK:YGEHY -24.4%.
    • First Solar (FSLR -3%) is lower despite winning an upgrade to Buy from Hold with a $60 price target at Argus Research, citing the company's position in the solar industry with "positive cash flow, solid balance sheet and focus on cadmium telluride technology, which should provide a cost advantage relative to more commoditized technologies."
    • It's the second upgrade for FSLR in as many days, after Goldman Sachs raised its rating to Neutral from Sell, citing valuation and mentioning the company's 2019 guidance as a potential "tactical catalyst" for upward revisions to consensus estimates.
    • ETF: TAN
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 10 Comments
  • XIN

    Xinyuan Real Estate the only financial gainers; PPDAI Group and InfraREIT among losers

    • Gainers: Xinyuan Real Estate (NYSE:XIN) +6%.
    • Losers: The Bank of N.T. Butterfield & Son (NYSE:NTB) -10%. Bank OZK (NASDAQ:OZK) -9%. PPDAI Group (NYSE:PPDF) -9%. InfraREIT (NYSE:HIFR) -8%. World Acceptance (NASDAQ:WRLD) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 4 Comments
  • DXCM

    DexCom down 10% as Investor Day proceeds

    • Investors appear to be disappointed with DexCom's (DXCM -9.5%) message during its Investor Day which started a little more than an hour ago. Shares are down on average volume.
    • Apparently, management has guided Q4 revenue of $283.1M, below consensus of $284.8M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • AETI

    Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: Safe-T Group (NASDAQ:SFET) +26%. American Electric Technologies (NASDAQ:AETI) +20%. Twist Bioscience (NASDAQ:TWST) +18%. Revance Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RVNC) +17%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +17%. Iterum Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ITRM) +14%. Movado Group (NYSE:MOV) +13%. Aduro BioTech (NASDAQ:ADRO) +12%. Arvinas Holding Company (NASDAQ:ARVN) +11%. Avaya Holdings (NYSE:AVYA) +10%.
    • Losers: Barnes & Noble Education (NYSE:BNED) -29%. Aphria (NYSE:APHA) -21%. Aridis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARDS) -22%. Skyline Champion (NYSEMKT:SKY) -15%. Orchids Paper Products (NYSEMKT:TIS) -13%. Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS) -12%. Kornit Digital (NASDAQ:KRNT) -12%. Builders FirstSource (NASDAQ:BLDR) -12%. ReneSola (NYSE:SOL) -12%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 4 Comments
  • VZ

    AT&T pledges 5G smartphone in first half of 2019

    • Fresh off reassurances from Verizon (VZ +0.5%) that it will have Samsung 5G phones ready in the first half of 2019, AT&T (T -1.9%) says its second mobile 5G device will be a Samsung smartphone in the same time frame.
    • That phone will give those on a compatible plan access to the 5G network AT&T says it will roll out before the end of the month.
    • AT&T says as of today it's installed mobile 5G network equipment in areas of the 12 introduction markets, with plans to expand to seven additional cities in the first half of next year.
    • It also says it's working with Samsung on a manufacturing-focused 5G Innovation Zone, a testbed to understand the impact of 5G on smart, robotics-driven factories.
    • Previously: Report: 5G iPhones coming in 2020 (Dec. 03 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 18 Comments
  • MEGEF

    Alberta's planned oil output cuts saved jobs at MEG Energy, CEO says

    • MEG Energy (OTCPK:MEGEF -1.8%) CEO Derek Evans says the company was considering laying off workers and cutting production at its Christina Lake project by 30% until Alberta’s mandated oil production cuts lifted prices for Canadian heavy crude.
    • "As of last Friday, we were trying to figure out how we could minimize, absolutely minimize, our capital expenditure," Evans tells Bloomberg, but the cuts announced over the weekend have "taken away the belief that we’re going to have to lay off people before Christmas."
    • Canadian producers, which finished mostly higher yesterday, are generally lower today: CVE -1.7%, CNQ -1.2%, SU +0.1%, IMO +0.8%, ENB -0.6%, ECA -3.4%, TRP -0.5%, CPG -2.6%, BTE -4.9%, ERF -2%, OTCPK:HUSKF -0.6%, OTCPK:ATHOF +0.8%, OTCPK:SPGYF -3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 11 Comments
  • CYAD

    Positive early-stage data on Celyad's lead candidate fails to lift shares, down 8%

    • Ultra-thinly traded Celyad (CYAD -8.2%) is down on average volume, only 5,129 shares, despite its announcement of encouraging results from a Phase 1 dose-escalation clinical trial, THINK, evaluating lead CAR-T candidate CYAD-01 without preconditioning chemo in patients with solid tumors and blood cancers. The data were presented at ASH in San Diego.
    • In eight patients with relapsed/refractory acute myeloid leukemia (AML), the response rate was 38% (n=3/8) and the disease control rate (responders + stable cancer) was 63% (n=5/8).
    • On the safety front, 6 of 14 (43%) patients with AML, myelodysplastic syndrome or multiple myeloma who received CYAD-01 experienced serious or life-threatening treatment-related adverse events, including cytokine release syndrome (CRS) (3), lymphopenia (low level of lymphocytes) and thrombocytopenia (low blood platelets). One case of life-threatening CRS was considered a dose-limiting toxicity.
    • #ASH18
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 4 Comments
  • BAC

    Banks get hammered by sliding Treasury yields

    • Banks lead midday U.S. stock market declines as the U.S. Treasury yields narrow and news that trade talks with China weren't as productive as originally made out to be.
    • The 2-10 curve now stands at a mere 11 basis points.
    • Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (NYSEARCA:XLF) -3.6%; YTD,it's now down 4.7%.
    • Looking at individual stocks: Bank of America (BAC -4.9%), Citigroup (C -4.1%), JPMorgan Chase (JPM -2.9%), Wells Fargo (WFC -3.3%), Goldman Sachs Group (GS -3%), and Morgan Stanley (MS -4.9%).
    • SPDR S&P Regional Banking ETF (NYSEARCA:KRE) sinks 5.4%; YTD, -7.2%
    • Among the biggest decliners: Bank OZK (OZK -9.1%), which was downgraded by Piper today; Regions Financial (RF -5.5%), Fifth Third (FITB -5.4%), Axos Financial (AX -5.3%), SunTrust Banks (STI -5%), PNC Financial (PNC -4.8%), and CIT Group (CIT -4.8%).
    • Previously: Averages tumble in afternoon action (Dec. 4)
    • ETFs: XLF, FAS, FAZ, VFH, UYG, FNCL, IYF, BTO, IYG, RYF, FXO, SEF-OLD, FINU, FINZ, JHMF
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 88 Comments
  • VOD

    Vodafone refreshes enterprise branding after annual trends report

    • Vodafone (VOD -2.1%) is refreshing its enterprise division branding in conjunction with the release of its 2019 Global Trends Report.
    • The enterprise unit is now called Vodafone Business and the Global Trends Report points to customer-centricity, ethics and purpose, and the impact of artificial intelligence as key business priorities over the coming 12 months.
    • The company's survey covered 1,700 global businesses and found that 88% of them said transforming the customer experience is a key objective, hinting that it might mean a shift toward long-term employees rather than freelancers or gig economy workers.
    • Some 83% of businesses believe acting in an ethical manner generates more revenue, but only 48% of millennials believe businesses behave ethically.
    • And 86% of businesses think AI will lead to different jobs, while 83% think work will be more productive when machine-augmented.

  • CAT

    Caterpillar not the way to play U.S.-China trade truce, analyst says

    • It's easy come easy go for Caterpillar (CAT -4.7%) shares, which have surrendered all of yesterday's gains that followed the U.S.-China trade truce and an upgrade from BofA Merrill Lynch.
    • But Ari Wald, head of technical analysis at Oppenheimer, says CAT is not the stock to take advantage of the trade war truce, telling CNBC that "in general, we are cautious on capital goods stocks that are exposed to the global economy and what we see as a decelerating macro backdrop."
    • "If you're buying this stock, you're making the case that the global backdrop is bullish," according to Wald. "What we instead see is a stock rallying into very formidable resistance at around $142."
    • BK Asset Management managing director of forex strategy Boris Schlossberg is more bullish on the shares, saying "The Fed seems to be easing its monetary path cycle, and therefore if it really isn't going to hike rates as much as the market thinks in 2019, that's positive for Caterpillar, which obviously [would have] a lower cost of capital."

    • Updated data from a Phase 1/1b clinical trial evaluating TG Therapeutics' (TGTX +2.2%) ublituximab, a glycoengineered anti-CD20 monoclonal antibody, combined with PI3K delta inhibitor umbralisib (TGR-1202) (called "U2") and chemo agent bendamustine, in patients with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) and follicular lymphoma (FL) showed a treatment effect.     • Zelnick has been floated as a potential next leader of the broadcast company, and Take-Two has even been lumped in with three-way merger speculation as observers weigh the recombination of CBS with Viacom (VIA, VIAB).
    • “But the job of a non-executive chairman is obviously to convene and to support the company’s management as they grow and build and create value in the company. That’s it," Zelnick says.
    • Korn Ferry is assisting in an executive search expected to take another few months at least; interim CEO Joe Ianniello is working to prove himself ready for the job after serving as Moonves' lieutenant.

  • TIF

    Tough times for Tiffany

    • Wells Fargo checks in on Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) with the luxury retailer sitting right smack in the middle of a trade battle between the U.S. and China.
    • The firm attributes the slowdown in Chinese consumption to "currency fluctuations, price reductions on the Mainland and a recent crackdown on China’s 'daigou' (an industry based on shoppers buying luxury goods overseas and bringing them back to China)."

  • GTHX

    G1 Therapeutics up 13% premarket on trilaciclib data in TNBC

    • G1 Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GTHX) is up 13% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement of preliminary data from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating trilaciclib + chemo in patients with metastatic triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). The results will be presented tomorrow at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium.
    • Interim progression-free survival (PFS) was 5.4 months in the gemcitabine and carboplatin (GC) arm, 8.8 months in patients receiving one cycle of trilaciclib (Tx1) + GC and 7.3 months in patients receiving two cycles of trilaciclib (Tx2) + GC.
    • The objective response rate (ORR) was 29.2% in the GC arm, 43.3% in the Tx1/GC arm and 36.7% in the Tx2/GC arm.
    • Overall survival (OS) has not been reached.
    • Trilaciclib is a short-acting CDK4/6 inhibitor that the company says preserves hematopoietic stem cells and enhances immune system function during chemotherapy.
    • Previously: G1 Therapeutics announces positive Trilaciclib Phase 2a data showing robust Myelopreservation benefits in patients with SCLC (March 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • RVNC

    Revance’s RT002 demonstrates positive results in aesthetic neuromodulator clinical program

    • Revance Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RVNC) announces that its long-acting neuromodulator DaxibotulinumtoxinA for Injection (RT002) delivered positive top-line results in alleviating moderate-to-severe glabellar (frown) lines in the SAKURA 3 Phase 3 open-label, long-term safety study.
    • Revance plans to submit a BLA with the FDA in H1 2019.
    • The SAKURA 3 study included nearly 2,700 patients and more than 3,800 treatments.
    • For efficacy, more than 95% of patients achieved a score of none or mild glabellar lines at maximum frown at Week 4.
    • The median time to return to baseline glabellar line severity was 28 weeks. The median time to loss of none or mild wrinkle severity was 24 weeks.
    • Revance will begin studies in 2019 in forehead and lateral canthal lines (crow’s feet) to explore the use and dosage of RT002 in the upper face.
    • Shares are up 3% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 1 Comment

    Monster dips on Wells Fargo caution

    • Wells Fargo is cautious on Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) after conducting its latest "Beverage Buzz" retailer survey.
    • The firm points to an acceleration in Red Bull sales since Monster's pricing actions and warns on new competition from Bang. Retailers reported back to WF that they expect Monster's growth in FY19 to be +4.5% vs. a prior expectation for a 6.3% increase.
    • Adding it all up, analyst Bonnie Herzog says Monster (Market Perform, $55 PT) doesn't deserve to trade at a 2019 PE multiple of 31X.

    Analysts cut Cirrus targets on guidance

    • Analysts cut Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) targets after the company trimmed its guidance on weak smartphone demand.
    • Craig-Hallum drops CRUS from $47 to $44 noting Cirrus lost content with Apple this iPhone cycle between the lower ASP chipset and the loss of the dongle included in the box. Cirrus is securing about $4 in total content per phone, down from $5.50 in the last cycle.
    • The firm does think Cirrus will gain more content in the 2019 iPhones and, in the near-term, there's the opportunity to expand in Samsung's mid-tier devices.
    • More action: Cowen drops Cirrus from $42 to $39. The firm is optimistic about Cirrus Logic's long-term audio IC expertise, but the near-term Apple exposure overshadows for now.
    • Source: StreetAccount.
    • CRUS is down 6% premarket to $36.35.
